zh.title: 美元/日元技术分析：[短期震荡趋势]
zh.content:
当前美元/日元的价格在154.28附近，显示出一定的震荡趋势。尽管市场在过去24小时内小幅下跌0.02%，但价格依然维持在154.25至154.32的区间内，显示出市场参与者对这一价位的关注。若价格突破154.32，可能会引发进一步上涨。

从技术指标来看，尽管RSI(14)数据缺失，MACD值为0.1413，表明当前走势略偏强，但缺乏明确的买入信号。SMA(20)在154.10附近形成支撑，若价格回调至此水平，将是一个较好的买入机会，投资者可关注这一点位。

在支撑和阻力位方面，154.25为短期支撑位，而154.32则是重要的阻力位。若价格突破154.32，可能会进一步向154.50靠近。相反，跌破154.25将可能引发更多卖盘，测试更低的支撑区间。

交易建议方面，投资者可以考虑在154.10附近建立多头仓位，止损设置在154.20下方，目标看向154.50。对于风险厌恶型投资者，建议观望，等待更明确的市场信号再作决策。

en.title: US Dollar vs Japanese Yen Technical Analysis
en.content:
The USD/JPY pair is currently trading at 154.29, showing a minor decline of 0.02% over the past 24 hours. The recent price action suggests that the pair is consolidating within a tight range, with a notable high at 154.325 and a low at 154.253. This consolidation could indicate a pause in momentum, potentially setting the stage for a breakout in either direction. Traders should closely monitor price movements around these levels for signs of future volatility.

In terms of technical indicators, the MACD reading of 0.1413 suggests a bullish momentum, although without a clear signal line value, caution is warranted. The absence of the RSI makes it difficult to assess overbought or oversold conditions, but the price is currently above the 20-period Simple Moving Average (SMA), which may act as a dynamic support level. A sustained move above the SMA could indicate a stronger bullish trend, while a dip below it might suggest bearish pressure.

Support is currently identified at the low of 154.253, while resistance can be found near the recent high of 154.325. A breakthrough above the resistance level could open the door for a rally toward the next psychological level at 155.00. Conversely, a drop below support may lead traders to target the next significant support area around 154.00. These levels are critical for assessing potential trade entries and exits.

For traders considering positions in USD/JPY, it may be prudent to adopt a wait-and-see approach until a clear breakout occurs. Entering long positions above 154.325 could capitalize on bullish momentum, while short positions could be considered if the price convincingly breaks below 154.253. Utilizing stop-loss orders just outside these key levels can help manage risk effectively in this current trading environment.
